entries.title: IRS Delays Gig-Tax Filing Rule for Side Hustles of More Than $600
entries.description: The Internal Revenue Service gives millions of Americans a one-year reprieve on new 1099-K tax-reporting requirements, offering relief to users of e-commerce platforms such as eBay, Etsy and Airbnb.

entries.title: AT&T to Build Broadband Services Outside Current Markets
entries.description: The telecom company would form a joint venture with BlackRock to fund the rollout of fiber-optic networks in new markets.

entries.title: Musk Invokes Twitter Succession Without Giving Clarity on Successor
entries.description: The billionaire owner of the social-media platform has assembled a team to keep the platform running while questions on the top job go unanswered.

entries.title: Meta to Pay $725 Million to Settle Cambridge Analytica Lawsuit
entries.description: The proposed settlement would fund payouts to U.S.-based users of Facebook, in what plaintiffs say could be the largest U.S. class-action privacy settlement ever.

entries.title: Elon Musk's SpaceX Stake Moves Lower, But Executive Retains Control
entries.description: His trust holds almost 80% of voting rights at SpaceX, though his equity ownership of the company has fallen.

entries.title: Microsoft Challenges FTC Suit Over Activision Deal
entries.description: The software giant filed court documents opposing claims that the $75 billion transaction would harm competition in the videogame industry.
